intro: Hedyotis purpurea var. tenuifolia, commonly known as slender purple dot, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It typically grows to a height of about 30-60 cm, featuring slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. Its foliage is often covered in fine hairs, and the leaves are usually lanceolate in shape. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats.
